content.en: Game-theoretic security: Researchers have been exploring how game theory and algorithms can be used to enhance security measures in various domains. For example, ARMOR is a software assistant agent that uses game theory to randomize monitoring routes in airport security. PROTECT is a game-theoretic system deployed by the United States Coast Guard to strategically allocate security resources. These advancements in computational game theory have the potential to improve security scheduling, resource allocation, and decision-making in the face of evolving threats.
content.da: Spilteoretisk sikkerhed: Forskere har undersøgt, hvordan spilteori og algoritmer kan bruges til at forbedre sikkerhedsforanstaltninger i forskellige domæner. For eksempel er ARMOR en software-assistentagent, der bruger spilteori til at tilfældigt vælge overvågningsruter i lufthavnssikkerhed. PROTECT er et spilleoretisk system, der er implementeret af United States Coast Guard til strategisk allokering af sikkerhedsressourcer. Disse fremskridt inden for beregningsmæssig spilteori har potentialet til at forbedre sikkerhedsplanlægning, ressourceallokering og beslutningstagning i mødet med nye trusler.
